question_text_raw:
News about politics and current affairs, watching, reading or listening, in minutes
ASK ALL
On a typical day, about how much time do you spend watching, reading or listening to news about politics and current affairs?
Please give your answer in hours and minutes. 
INTERVIEWER: If no time spent, enter 00 00. 
TYPE IN DURATION
question_cleaned: On a typical day, about how much time do you spend watching, reading, or listening to news about politics and current affairs?
notes: Removed interviewer instructions and data-entry notes. Respondents' answers recorded as duration in hours and minutes (HH MM); 00 00 indicates no time spent. Kept original special codes for missing values.
notes_2: Removed the explicit instruction to give the answer in hours and minutes to make the wording more natural while keeping the question appropriate for a time-based numeric response.

question_text_raw:
Internet use, how often
CARD 1
People can use the internet on different devices such as computers, tablets and smartphones. How often do you use the internet on these or any other devices, whether for work or personal use?
question_cleaned: How often do you use the internet on any device, whether for work or personal use?
notes: Removed 'CARD 1' and the explanatory device examples; reworded as a direct question. No changes to response categories.
notes_2: Minor wording tweak for flow; meaning and response scale unchanged.

question_text_raw:
Internet use, how much time on typical day, in minutes
ASK IF MOST DAYS OR EVERY DAY AT A2 (IF A2 = 4, 5)
On a typical day, about how much time do you spend using the internet on a computer, tablet, smartphone or other device, whether for work or personal use?
Please give your answer in hours and minutes. 
INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION
question_cleaned: On a typical day, about how many hours do you spend using the internet on any device (computer, tablet, or smartphone) for work or personal use?
notes: Removed routing ('ASK IF...') and interviewer instruction ('INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN DURATION'). Rephrased for clarity. Only special/missing codes were provided; numeric duration responses are not included in the mapping.
notes_2: Removed explicit 'hours and minutes' instruction and rephrased to a natural estimate in hours; otherwise minor wording smoothing.

question_text_raw:
Most people can be trusted or you can't be too careful
ASK ALL 
CARD 2
Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people? Please tell me on a score of 0 to 10, where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means that most people can be trusted.
question_cleaned: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?
notes: Removed card/interviewer instructions. Collapsed original 0–10 scale into 5 categories (0–1, 2–3, 4–6, 7–8, 9–10); preserved original endpoint wording for extremes and retained special codes.
notes_2: Removed the explicit instruction to answer on a 0–10 scale; retained original wording to match the trust scale.

notes_2: Minor wording smoothed for natural language; added instruction to indicate if respondent is still studying to match response categories (still at school/college/university).

question_text_raw:
Years of full-time education completed
ASK ALL
About how many years of education have you completed, whether full-time or part-time? Please report these in full-time equivalents and include compulsory years of schooling.
INTERVIEWER: round answer up or down to the nearest whole year.
TYPE IN:
question_cleaned: About how many years of education have you completed, counting part-time study as the equivalent of full-time study and including any required (compulsory) schooling?
notes: Removed administrative prompts ('ASK ALL', 'TYPE IN') and interviewer prefix; rephrased into natural question. Kept rounding instruction in the question. Removed asterisks from value labels. Numeric year responses are recorded as years (not listed here); only special codes were provided in the original mapping.
notes_2: Removed the explicit instruction to round to the nearest whole year and simplified wording while keeping the request to report full-time equivalents and include compulsory schooling.

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: paid work
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? In paid work (or away temporarily) (employee, self-employed, working for your family business)
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: In the past 7 days, did you do any paid work (including if you were temporarily away), for example as an employee, self-employed, or working in a family business?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer prompts; rephrased into a direct question. Preserved original binary coding/labels.
notes_2: Minor wording changes for natural flow: 'last 7 days' → 'past 7 days', moved 'including temporarily away', 'working for your family business' → 'working in a family business'.

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: education
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? In education (not paid for by employer) even if on vacation
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: In the past seven days, did you attend any education or training that was not paid for by your employer, even if you were on vacation?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer prompts. This is a select-all-that-apply (checkbox) item about activities in the last 7 days; response labels preserved as Not marked/Marked.
notes_2: Rephrased 'in education' to 'attend any education or training' for clarity, changed 'last 7 days' to 'past seven days', and made it a natural yes/no question consistent with the response scale.

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: unemployed, actively looking for job
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? Unemployed and actively looking for a job
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: In the past 7 days, were you unemployed and actively looking for a job?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer prompts; rephrased as a direct question. This is a select-all-that-apply checkbox (Marked = selected).
notes_2: Minor wording change: 'During the last 7 days' -> 'In the past 7 days' for more natural phrasing; kept binary yes/no format.

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: unemployed, not actively looking for job
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? Unemployed, wanting a job but not actively looking for a job
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: During the past 7 days, were you unemployed, wanted a job, but were not actively looking for one?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer prompts (e.g., 'Using this card', 'Select all that apply', 'PROMPT'). Rephrased as a direct checkbox item about the last 7 days. This is a select-all-that-apply (checkbox) item.
notes_2: Minor tense and wording adjustments for naturalness; retained as a yes/no question.

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: permanently sick or disabled
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? Permanently sick or disabled
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: In the past 7 days, have you been permanently sick or disabled?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer prompts; rephrased as a direct question. Simplified response labels from 'Not marked'/'Marked' to 'Not selected'/'Selected'.
notes_2: Minor wording change: 'In the last 7 days' → 'In the past 7 days' to sound more natural; preserved binary yes/no format and original phrase.

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: retired
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? Retired
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: Were you retired in the past seven days?
notes: Removed card reference and interviewer instructions. Rephrased as a direct yes/no question; 'Marked' indicates the respondent selected this option in the select-all-that-apply item.
notes_2: Minor rephrasing from 'In the last seven days, were you retired?' to more natural 'Were you retired in the past seven days?'

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: community or military service
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? In community or military service
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: During the past 7 days, have you been engaged in community or military service activities?
notes: Removed card references and interviewer prompts; rephrased into natural question and retained 'select all that apply' instruction.
notes_2: Minor wording changes for natural phrasing ('In the last 7 days' → 'During the past 7 days'; clarified 'what you have been doing' to 'activities you have been doing').

question_text_raw:
Doing last 7 days: housework, looking after children, others
CARD 47
Using this card, which of these descriptions applies to what you have been doing for the last 7 days? Doing housework, looking after children or other persons
Select all that apply.
PROMPT Which others?
CODE ALL THAT APPLY
question_cleaned: In the past 7 days, have you done housework, looked after children, or cared for other people?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer prompts; rephrased as a direct yes/no question. Simplified response labels from 'Not marked'/'Marked' to 'No'/'Yes'. Original item was part of a select-all-that-apply list.
notes_2: Minor wording change: 'last' → 'past' for more natural phrasing; otherwise unchanged to preserve yes/no response format.

question_text_raw:
Main activity last 7 days
ASK IF MORE THAN ONE CODED AT F17a
STILL CARD 47
And which of these descriptions best describes your situation (in the last seven days)?
Please select only one.
CODE ONE ANSWER ONLY
question_cleaned: What has been your main activity in the last seven days?
notes: Removed routing and card instructions (e.g., 'ASK IF...', 'STILL CARD 47') and interviewer notes; rephrased into a direct question. Cleaned special-category labels by removing asterisks.
notes_2: Removed the directive 'Please select one option' to make the wording more natural; changed 'situation' to 'activity', otherwise unchanged.

question_text_raw:
Main activity, last 7 days. All respondents. Post coded
POST CODE: MAIN ACTIVITY
question_cleaned: What was your main activity in the last 7 days?
notes: Removed 'POST CODE' survey artifact and rephrased question into natural wording; removed asterisks from missing-data labels.

question_text_raw:
Control paid work last 7 days
ASK IF NOT IN PAID WORK AT F17a (IF NOT 01 at F17a)
Can I just check, did you do any paid work of an hour or more in the last seven days?
question_cleaned: Did you do any paid work for at least one hour in the past seven days?
notes: Removed routing/instruction text ('ASK IF...') and rephrased as a direct question. Simplified missing-value labels by removing asterisks.
notes_2: Minor wording change: 'for at least one hour' replaced 'of an hour or more' and 'past' replaced 'last' for natural phrasing.

question_text_raw:
Ever had a paid job
ASK IF NO OR DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT F18 (IF F18 = 2, 7, 8)
Have you ever had a paid job?
question_cleaned: Have you ever had a paid job?
notes: Removed routing instruction ('ASK IF ...') from question text and removed asterisks from special-code labels.

question_text_raw:
Year last in paid job
ASK IF YES AT F19 (IF F19 = 1)
In what year were you last in a paid job?
TYPE IN YEAR:
question_cleaned: What year were you last in a paid job?
notes: Removed routing instruction and data-entry prompt ('ASK IF...', 'TYPE IN YEAR'). Preserved special missing-value codes and simplified labels by removing asterisks.
notes_2: Minor rewording for a more conversational tone; meaning unchanged.

question_text_raw:
Employment relation
INTERVIEWER: If respondent currently in work, F21 to F34a refer to their current job; if not in paid work but had a job in the past, F21 to F34a refer to their last job.
INTERVIEWER: If the respondent has more than one job, they should answer about the one which occupies them for the most hours per week. If they have two jobs that are exactly equal, they should answer about the more highly paid of the two.
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1)
In your main job {are/were} you...
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: In your main job (current or most recent), were you an employee, self-employed, or working for your own family business?
notes: Removed interviewer instructions and routing (current vs. past job) and rephrased into a natural question. Response categories unchanged aside from removing asterisks from special codes.

question_text_raw:
Number of employees respondent has/had
ASK IF SELF-EMPLOYED AT F21 (IF F21 = 2)
How many employees (if any) {do/did} you have?
TYPE IN number of employees:
question_cleaned: How many employees do or did you have, if any?
notes: Removed routing instruction and interviewer/type-in prompt. Kept original special codes and labels unchanged.
notes_2: Minor rewording for more natural flow; retained original meaning and response type (numeric count).

question_text_raw:
Employment contract unlimited or limited duration
ASK IF EMPLOYEE OR FAMILY BUSINESS OR DON'T KNOW/REFUSAL AT F21 (IF F21 = 1, 3, 7, 8)
{Do/did} you have a work contract of...
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: Do you have a work contract of unlimited duration, limited duration, or no contract?
notes: Removed routing instructions and 'READ OUT' prompt; rephrased into a natural question. Cleaned missing-data labels by removing asterisks.

question_text_raw:
Establishment size
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1)
Including yourself, about how many people {are/were} employed at the place where you usually {work/worked}...
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: Including yourself, about how many people are employed at the place where you usually work or worked?
notes: Removed routing, interviewer instructions, and 'READ OUT' prompt. Simplified question wording and preserved current/past employment reference by using 'work or worked'. Removed asterisks from value labels.

question_text_raw:
Responsible for supervising other employees
In your main job,  {do/did} you have any responsibility for supervising the work of other employees?
question_cleaned: In your main job, do or did you have any responsibility for supervising the work of other employees?
notes: Removed heading and survey formatting; rephrased {do/did} to 'do or did' for clarity. Preserved original special codes.

question_text_raw:
Number of people responsible for in job
ASK IF YES AT F25 (IF F25 = 1)
How many people {are/were} you responsible for?
TYPE IN:
question_cleaned: In that job, how many people were you responsible for?
notes: Removed routing instruction ('ASK IF YES AT F25') and data-entry prompt ('TYPE IN'). Treated as an open numeric response; preserved special codes for non-substantive answers.
notes_2: Minor rewording for natural flow; no change to meaning (question expects a numeric count).

question_text_raw:
Allowed to decide how daily work is organised
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1) 
CARD 48
I am going to read out a list of things about your working life. Using this card, please say how much the management at your work {allows/allowed} you... ...to decide how your own daily work {is/was} organised?
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: How much does or did management at your workplace let you decide how to organize your daily work?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer notes. Reworded to cover past or present employment ('does or did'). Collapsed 11-point (0–10) scale into 5 categories: 0-1 No influence; 2-3 Little influence; 4-6 Some influence; 7-8 High influence; 9-10 Complete control. Simplified special-code labels (removed asterisks).
notes_2: Made wording slightly more conversational ('let you decide' and 'organize'); preserved 'does or did' to cover present or past situations and kept meaning consistent with influence/control scale.

question_text_raw:
Allowed to influence policy decisions about activities of organisation
ASK IF IN PAID WORK AT F17a OR F18, OR NOT IN PAID WORK BUT HAD A JOB IN THE PAST AT F19 (IF 01 AT F17a OR F18 = 1 OR F19 = 1) 
CARD 48
I am going to read out a list of things about your working life. Using this card, please say how much the management at your work {allows/allowed} you... ...to influence policy decisions about the activities of the organisation?
READ OUT...
question_cleaned: To what extent does or did management at your workplace allow you to influence policy decisions about your organisation's activities?
notes: Removed routing, card and interviewer instructions; preserved core meaning. Collapsed 11-point (0–10) scale into 5 categories (0-1, 2-3, 4-6, 7-8, 9-10). Simplified special missing-value labels.
notes_2: Minor wording change: replaced 'How much' with 'To what extent' and 'the organisation' with 'your organisation' for a more natural, conversational tone; otherwise content unchanged.

question_text_raw:
Total contracted hours per week in main job overtime excluded
What {are/were} your total 'basic' or contracted hours each week (in your main job), excluding any paid and unpaid overtime?
INTERVIEWER: 0 hours contract should be coded as 0 hours.
Acceptable range of responses is between 0 and 168 hours.
TYPE IN HOURS:

notes_2: Minor rewording for natural phrasing (moved 'in your main job' and changed 'excluding' to 'not including'); meaning unchanged and compatible with the provided special-response codes.

question_text_raw:
Total hours normally worked per week in main job overtime included
Regardless of your basic or contracted hours, how many hours do/did you normally work a week (in your main job), including any paid or unpaid overtime.
INTERVIEWER: Acceptable range of responses is between 0 and 168 hours.
TYPE IN HOURS:
question_cleaned: Regardless of your contracted hours, how many hours do you normally work per week in your main job, including any paid or unpaid overtime?

adjusted_values.0-168: Number of hours worked per week (numeric)

notes: Removed interviewer instructions and the 'TYPE IN HOURS' / acceptable-range note. Added a concise mapping for numeric responses (0-168 hours). Preserved original special codes and simplified their labels.

question_text_raw:
Paid work in another country, period more than 6 months last 10 years

question_cleaned: In the past 10 years, have you done any paid work in another country for six months or more?
notes: Removed redundant header text and rephrased as a natural question. Removed asterisks from special-value labels while preserving all original codes.
notes_2: Minor wording change: 'In the last 10 years' → 'In the past 10 years' for natural phrasing; otherwise left as a yes/no question to match the response scale.

question_text_raw:
Ever unemployed and seeking work for a period more than three months
ASK ALL
Have you ever been unemployed and seeking work for a period of more than three months?
question_cleaned: Have you ever been unemployed and actively looking for work for more than three months?
notes: Removed survey instruction 'ASK ALL' and rephrased slightly; removed asterisks from missing-value labels.
notes_2: Reworded 'seeking work' to 'actively looking for work' for more natural phrasing; otherwise unchanged to match the yes/no response scale.

question_text_raw:
Any period of unemployment and work seeking lasted 12 months or more
ASK IF YES AT F36 (IF F36 = 1)
Have any of these periods lasted for 12 months or more?
question_cleaned: Have you had any periods of unemployment or of actively looking for work that lasted 12 months or more?
notes: Removed routing instruction ('ASK IF YES AT F36') and rephrased for clarity. Removed asterisks from special-value labels.
notes_2: Made the question personal ('you'), clarified 'job-seeking' as 'actively looking for work', and changed 'and' to 'or' for natural phrasing; otherwise matched the yes/no response scale.

INTERVIEWER: 'These periods' refer to the periods of more than 3 months at F36
question_cleaned: In the past five years, have you had any periods of unemployment during which you were actively looking for work for more than three months?
notes: Removed interviewer instruction and card reference; clarified that 'these periods' refers to unemployment spells longer than three months and rephrased into a direct question.
notes_2: Minor rephrasing for natural conversational flow; retained original meaning and binary response options.

notes: Removed 'ASK ALL' and conditional survey wording; rephrased into conversational form. Removed asterisks from special-code labels.
notes_2: Reworded into a single natural question listing current/past/never to match the response categories; removed the 'If yes' follow-up.

question_text_raw:
Important to think new ideas and being creative
Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. Thinking up new ideas and being creative is important to her/him. She/he likes to do things in her/his own original way.
question_cleaned: How much does this description sound like you: "Thinking up new ideas and being creative is important to you; you like to do things in your own original way"?
notes: Removed introductory wording and card/interviewer instructions; rephrased as a direct question and made pronouns gender-neutral. No changes to response categories.
notes_2: Replaced third-person 'them' with second-person 'you' and rephrased 'How much is the following description like you' to the more natural 'How much does this description sound like you'.

question_text_raw:
Important to be rich, have money and expensive things
Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. It is important to her/him to be rich. She/he wants to have a lot of money and expensive things.
question_cleaned: To what extent does the following description apply to you: "Being rich is important; I want to have a lot of money and expensive things"?
notes: Removed card instructions and interviewer wording; rephrased into a direct question. Preserved original response categories and special codes.
notes_2: Rephrased into a more natural lead-in and changed the quote to first-person wording to match how respondents would self-assess; kept Likert intent intact.

question_text_raw:
Important that people are treated equally and have equal opportunities
Now I will briefly describe some people. Please listen to each description and tell me how much each person is or is not like you. Use this card for your answer. She/he thinks it is important that every person in the world should be treated equally. She/he believes everyone should have equal opportunities in life.
question_cleaned: How much is this person like you—someone who believes it's important that everyone be treated equally and have equal opportunities in life?
notes: Removed introductory/card instructions and interviewer notes; rephrased into a direct, conversational question. Special/missing codes preserved (asterisks removed for clarity).
notes_2: Slightly rephrased for natural conversational tone (e.g., 'believes it's important that' instead of 'thinks it is important that'); meaning and response scale unchanged.

question_text_raw:
Important to show abilities and be admired

notes: Removed card and interviewer instructions; rephrased item into a direct first-person statement. Removed asterisks from special-code labels. No change to substantive response categories.
notes_2: Clarified wording to reference the statement explicitly; no change to response scale.

question_text_raw:
Important to live in secure and safe surroundings

notes_2: Reworded to first-person and made the phrasing more conversational; meaning and response scale unchanged.

question_text_raw:

question_text_raw:

question_text_raw:

question_text_raw:

question_text_raw:

question_text_raw:

question_text_raw:
